title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Wednesday, 16 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: chancellor george osborne confirms east anglian devolution plans .
cambridge city football club stadium 'given green light ' .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our coverage through the day
text: the cambridgeshire live team will be back tomorrow at 08:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county .
until then you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: devolution : returning power to east anglia for first time since 10th century
text: if plans for devolution in cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk come to fruition , it will return powers to east anglia for the first time since the 10th century .
during the dark ages , east anglia was an independent anglo saxon kingdom .
it is believed the famous treasure found at sutton hoo in suffolk ( above ) belonged to king raedwald , who ruled in the 7th century .
it was later conquered by the vikings after they killed its last independent anglo saxon king st edmund .
in 917 the danes were defeated and it became part of a united england .

documents.title: cannabis plants discovered at wisbech fire home
text: cannabis plants discovered at a wisbech home gutted by fire at the weekend are not being connected to the blaze , police have confirmed .
a one-year-old boy was taken to broomfield hospital in chelmsford for specialist burns treatment after emergency services were called to the property in lime avenue at 08:30 on saturday .
a spokesman for cambridgeshire police said `` around 20 '' plants were discovered in the loft .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: simon dobbin : 'hello , gorgeous . you 're home '
text: assaulted cambridge united fan simon dobbin is finally home in mildenhall after spending almost a year in hospital .
mr dobbin was attacked near a southend pub after a match at roots hall last march .
reporter anna todd was in mildenhall earlier and spoke with mr dobbin 's daughter , emily .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : east anglian devolution plans unveiled new cambridge city stadium 'given green light '
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : barton road set to reopen after repair works
text: barton road in cambridge is set to reopen tomorrow morning after being closed for almost a week due to a burst water main .
cambridge water says localised flooding damaged the sub-structure of the carriageway , which has had to be repaired .
a spokesman for the company said : `` we 're working to get everything back to normal as quickly as possible and hope to have the road reopened in time for tomorrow morning 's rush hour . ''
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: george osborne announces east anglia devolution - but cambridgeshire county council could reject it
text: an alliance of smaller parties on cambridgeshire county council looks set to throw another spanner in the works of george osborne 's devolution plan for east anglia .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: devolution deal : flying the flag for east anglia
text: following george osborne 's announcement of a devolution deal for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , will we see more flags of east anglia being flown around the region ?
the flag was designed in about 1900 and incorporates the english cross of st george , with a shield bearing three crowns ascribed in medieval times to the anglo saxon kingdom of east anglia .
it has recently been seen flying over norfolk county council 's headquarters and , as shown above , in this garden near cambridge .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution will 'boost growth and drive economy '
text: the chairman of the new anglia local enterprise partnership has welcomed the chancellor 's announcement of a devolution agreement for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .

mark pendlington said : `` devolution brings a great opportunity to release even more potential from our vibrant towns and cities , giving us greater influence , control and decision making over vital areas of our economy from creating jobs , boosting skills , supporting our businesses and building the homes that we so desperately need .
`` devolution offers us a way to achieve our ambitions and showcase our great industries . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: campaigners flushed with success after council heeds concerns over public toilet closure
text: public toilets in ely have been given a reprieve by the council after campaigners raised concerns about the impact their closure would have on disabled and elderly people .
east cambridgeshire district council has agreed to retain the toilets at barton road , near a drop-off point for visiting coaches , for another year .
but toilets in newham street and sacrist gate will shut .
the council told bbc radio cambridgeshire the closures would allow remaining public toilets to stay free-of-charge .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: warning to residents after car break-ins
text: thieves broke into seven vehicles in a single day in one area of peterborough and police are asking residents to take precautions .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: east anglian devolution : 'residents have been shut out '
text: cambridge city council remains a notable opponent of the east anglian devolution deal , which neighbouring councils across cambridgeshire as well as in norfolk and suffolk have signed up to .
lewis herbert , leader of cambridge city council , said : `` residents have been shut out of the rushed talks in the last four weeks .
`` we believe it is now time their voice is heard , not just by us , but also by the government on these proposals for a huge region and mayor . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution : elections for new mayor could take place in may 2017
text: under devolution plans for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , the first mayoral elections could be held in may 2017 .
the directly elected mayor would lead a new east anglia combined authority and would exercise the following powers :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution : deal needs to be ratified by local councils
text: the east anglian devolution deal announced by chancellor george osborne still needs to be ratified by councils in cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .

suffolk public sector leaders group , which comprises the leaders from all of the county 's district and borough councils and the county council , says further negotiation and clarification on the specifics of the deal will now take place , with `` extensive engagement '' with local communities and businesses .

documents.title: east anglian devolution : 'a profound transfer of powers from whitehall '
text: george nobbs , leader of norfolk county council , says the chancellor 's announcement of a draft devolution agreement for east anglia `` sees the start of a profound transfer of powers from whitehall to this region '' .
george osborne announced plans which he says will see a single authority and elected mayor for norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire .
`` each and every council in the region will now debate the draft document as details are worked up , '' mr nobbs said .
`` i am personally delighted that this is a deal specifically for east anglia .
`` this is not a region created by central dictate , it is deeply rooted in english history and has possessed a distinct identity for more than a thousand years . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: budget : £ 7m to fix potholes
text: as well as east anglian devolution , the chancellor george osborne also used the budget to allocate £ 7m to fix potholes in the east over the next year .
# budget2016 also allocates £ 7 mill to fill 136,000 potholes in east over the next year
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge city fc stadium green light 'great news for future of the club '
text: councillor lynda harford , chairman of south cambridgeshire district council 's planning committee , says she is `` very pleased '' the high court has upheld the council 's decision to allow cambridge city football club to build a new 3,000 capacity stadium in sawston .
`` the original planning application was considered on its merits following active local public consultation and debate , '' she said .
`` this is great news for the future of the football club and we will continue to work with them and local people to make sure that the whole community benefits from the stadium going ahead . ''

documents.title: breakingcambridge city football club stadium 'given green light '
text: a high court judge ruling has backed a local planning decision to allow cambridge city football club 's new 3,000-capacity football stadium to be built in sawston , south cambridgeshire district council says .

documents.title: more detail on east anglian devolution deal from treasury
text: hm treasury has revealed more details of chancellor george osborne 's devolution plans for east anglia :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mps react to east anglian devolution plans
text: mps , including mid-norfolk 's george freeman , have been reacting to the east anglian devolution announcement made by chancellor george osborne during the budget .
the plans pave the way for the creation of a single authority for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , with an elected mayor .
bingo .
a new c£ 1bn # devolutiondeal for east anglia # budget2016
@ twitterid not sure where that will get us in reality ?
@ twitterid very persuasive in @ twitterid article this morning
@ twitterid norfolk , suffolk and cambridge or just norfolk & suffolk ?
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: devolution announcement 'a significant step ' for east anglia
text: matthew hancock , conservative mp for west suffolk , says the chancellor 's devolution announcement is a `` significant step '' for east anglia .
george osborne announced plans which he says will hand more powers to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk during his budget .

`` the devolution deal brings more money , new powers , and will give us a strong local figurehead who can unite east anglia and make our case heard locally , nationally and internationally , '' mr hancock said .
`` i pay tribute to the hard work by many people that has enabled us to reach this point , and look forward to making local decision making a reality . ''

documents.title: chancellor promises £ 1bn investment as part of east anglian devolution
text: east anglian devolution plans will bring £ 1bn of investment to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , chancellor george osborne has announced in the budget .
this would be part of a deal introducing a single authority and an elected mayor for the three counties .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingchancellor confirms east anglian devolution plans
text: george osborne has used the budget to unveil east anglian devolution plans , which he says will hand more powers to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .
the chancellor told mps the plans would see a single authority for east anglia , with an elected mayor , which will make sure `` the rewards of economic growth are in the hands of local people '' .

documents.title: simon dobbin : attacked cambridge united fan arrives home safely
text: we 've just heard that cambridge united football fan simon dobbin , who was seriously injured when attacked in southend , has finally returned to his home , almost a year since he left it to attend a match .
mr dobbin was rehabilitated in norfolk and has finally made the journey home to mildenhall in suffolk .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution : elected mayor would serve three counties
text: chancellor george osborne has begun his budget speech , in which he is expected to announce devolution plans and pave the way for an elected mayor for east anglia .
the idea is that a mayor would be elected to serve across norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire .
but we 're not yet at the stage of knowing when a mayor would be elected , and there 's a lot of ground to be travelled before any final deal is signed off .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: 'transformed ' duxford air museum to display previously unseen items
text: the `` transformed '' american air museum at duxford , which is being unveiled today , will be home to 850 objects , including equipment , uniforms , keepsakes and photographs - many of which have not been on public display before .

a spokesman for the imperial war museum , which oversees the collection , says the collection will tell `` the personal stories of people whose lives have shaped or been shaped by their experiences of conflict '' .
the museum has been closed for the past year while the £ 3m redevelopment was carried out .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : cambridge council opposed to east anglian devolution plans duxford air museum to reopen after £ 3m transformation
text: if you are just joining us here , are the headlines in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: simon dobbin : cps to 'decide if 13 bailed men will face charges '
text: essex police has told the bbc that the 13 men arrested following the attack on cambridge united supporter simon dobbin in southend last march are still on bail .
mr dobbin , from mildenhall in suffolk , was outside a pub after attending a match at roots hall when the attack happened .
he has been in hospital for almost a year and is due to return home from rehabilitation in norwich today .
essex police has submitted a report to the cps , which will decide if there is sufficient evidence to prosecute them .
another man remains on bail and another three have had their bail cancelled , and face no further action .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: human rights and civil liberties enter cambridge 'punt wars '
text: civil liberty and human rights groups have joined the battleground in cambridge 's 'punt wars ' , after accusations the city council had a `` glaring '' self-interest in its bid to ban punt touts .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: simon dobbin : wife hopes football fan will make 'better progress at home '
text: the wife of cambridge united fan simon dobbin , who has been in hospital since being attacked outside a pub in southend nearly a year ago , says she hopes he will make better progress once he returns to his home in mildenhall later today .
nicole dobbin said : `` there 's really no change in him , he was saying a few words a few months ago , but he 's stopped that .
he 'll just say 'yes ' now .
`` he 's unable to walk , he 's being fed through a tube in his stomach , ca n't move his hands , so he 's still got a long road ahead of him .
i 'm just hoping that once he 's come home he 'll make better progress . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: american air museum at duxford set to reopen after year-long redevelopment
text: a £ 3m `` transformation '' of the american air museum at duxford is set to be revealed today .
the collection closed to the public last march to allow redevelopment work by the imperial war museum ( iwm ) .
diane lees , director-general of iwm , said : `` the transformed american air museum will tell the story of the relationship between britain and america in very human terms .
personal stories come to the fore , vividly demonstrating the consequences of war . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge council opposed to east anglian devolution plans
text: cambridge city council remains opposed to an east anglian devolution deal set to be unveiled by george osborne in the budget at lunchtime .
the majority of local authorities in the county are on board for the deal , which the government says will give greater local decision making in cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .
cambridge city council 's labour leader lewis herbert ( only had three weeks to make our case .
nobody outside the councils has had a say - we want to know what the public think . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: simon dobbin : long road home for attacked cambridge united fan
text: it 's been a long road home for simon dobbin , the cambridge united fan who was attacked in southend last march .
mr dobbin is finally due to return to his home in mildenhall today after nearly a year in hospital .
his wife nicole said : `` we had a discharge meeting in december , so i was thinking , you know , any time after that , he 'd be home .
but obviously things have to be put in place first and care packages have to be sorted out . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing willingham woman found 'safe and well '
text: police searching for a woman in her 80s , who went missing from her home in willingham yesterday evening , say she has been found `` safe and well '' .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: simon dobbin : preparations for return meant adapting home
text: nicole dobbin has told how her home in mildenhall has had to see some changes for the return later today of her husband simon , who was attacked in southend last year .
the cambridge united fan has spent nearly a year in hospital , latterly in rehabilitation in norfolk , after being attacked outside a pub in southend after a game at roots hall .
mrs dobbin said : `` i 've had to have the equipment delivered , so i 've got a hospital bed here for simon .
i 've got a reclining chair for him , a hoist , there 's been no work done on the house as yet because that can take anything from a year to 18 months .
`` we 've also had to have the fireplace knocked out to accommodate the furniture , obviously so there 's more room for simon . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: simon dobbin : 'face lit up ' when he knew he was coming home
text: simon dobbin , who has been in hospital for almost a year after being attacked in southend , was delighted to be returning home to suffolk , his wife has said .
the cambridge united fan will return to mildenhall later today after rehabilitation in norfolk .
his wife nicole said : `` i went in on monday and said 'you 've only got two more sleeps here , simon ' , and his face just lit up .
`` i said to him 'are you looking forward to coming home ? '
and i got a 'yes ! '
so he is aware that he 's coming home . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: simon dobbin : 'banners and balloons ' to mark his return home
text: `` balloons and banners '' have been put up by friends and neighbours to welcome home cambridge united football fan simon dobbin , who was attacked after a match in southend last year .
mr dobbin 's wife nicole told the bbc it would be an emotional day when he returns from rehabilitation to his home in mildenhall .
`` it was a year ago he walked out of the house and it 's a year later he 's coming back and we 're just so excited , '' she said .
`` i just do n't want anything to go wrong today . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chancellor expected to reveal east anglian devolution plans
text: chancellor george osborne is expected to use the budget to give details of east anglian devolution - handing more powers to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .
the devolution plans are expected to give greater local decision making over areas like transport , planning and education .
most of cambridgeshire 's councils are on board , but cambridge city council is not taking part , saying it does not think it is a good deal for the county .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : welney wash road remains closed due to flooding
text: thea1101 wash road ( welney causeway ) in welney remains closed because of flooding .
north bank in whittlesey also remains closed because of flooding .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: attacked football fan on way home at last
text: the cambridge united football fan who was left with brain damage after being beaten up following a match at southend is due home today , almost a year on since the attack .
simon dobbin was attacked outside the railway pub in southend last march after a game at the roots hall stadium .
mr dobbin , from mildenhall in suffolk , has been at a rehabilitation centre in norwich and is due home later today .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : staying dry today with some sunny spells
text: early mist patches will clear away , leaving us with a dry and bright day .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
you can find more on the forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : chancellor expected to reveal east anglian devolution details refurbishment completed at duxford 's american air museum
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : barton road remains closed following burst main
text: barton road in cambridge , one of the main commuter routes into the city , is still closed to allow resurfacing work following a burst water main .
for the latest on the roads head to bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: stay with us for the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county between now and 18:00
it looks like being a lovely day .
we 've a full weather forecast coming next , and do n't forget , you can get involved with our live page at any time .
send us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
